page.title: 05FARMING CHANGES AROUND LEWES
page.content: Farming around Lewes has recently seen much change.Old piggeries and small farms have been absorbed into larger farms. Many allotments remain for small vegetable growers. The Southern Water Authority's sluices and ditches, and farmers' drainage, now prevent much flooding, where one-time summer meadows can now grow cereals and rotation grasses. The Common Agricultural Policy of the EEC subsidises cereal prices, encouraging this change. Some farmers reduce their dairy herds as milk subsidies decrease On the Downs,farmers remove hedges and plough steep pastures,to sow heavily subsidised cereals.This has caused recent flooding in Lewes Nevill Estate. After heavy rain,surface run- off gathered in furrows,and thousands of gallons of water flowed though allotments,gardens and houses.
